channel.title: Safezone
channel.description: ok guys I know how to add safezones but when i search for the public boolean nonwild or nonwild or safezone I get nothing. RuneJava has no safezones to start with. Where can I add the boolean or the other things?

item.title: Safezone
item.dc:creator: @R_Y_A_N R Y A N
item.description:
@R_Y_A_N wrote:

[quote=“chassy13, post:1, topic:200044”]ok guys I know how to add safezones but when i search for the public boolean nonwild or nonwild or safezone I get nothing. RuneJava has no safezones to start with. Where can I add the boolean or the other things?[/quote]ehm ok… go to your client.java and search public void checkwildy() { or something like that

you should see something like this:

public void checkwildy() { if((absX >= 2806 && absX <= 2812 && absY >= 3438 && absY <= 3442)) { inwildy = false; } else { inwildy = true; } } public void checkwildy2() { if((absX >= 2806 && absX <= 2812 && absY >= 3438 && absY <= 3442)) { inwildy2 = false; } else { inwildy2 = true; } }

if you want everywere to be safe replace it with this

[code]public void checkwildy()
{
if((absX >= 2518 && absX <= 2531 && absY >= 4767 && absY <= 4786))
{
inwildy = true;
}
if((absX <= 2367 && absX >= 2434 && absY <= 3071 && absY >= 3137))
{
inwildy = true;
}
else
{
inwildy = false;
}
}

public void checkwildy2()
{
if((absX >= 2518 && absX <= 2531 && absY >= 4767 && absY <= 4786))
{
inwildy2 = true;
}
if((absX >= 2518 && absX <= 2531 && absY >= 4767 && absY <= 4786))
{
inwildy2 = true;
}
if((absX >= 2367 && absX <= 2434 && absY >= 3071 && absY <= 3137))
{
inwildy2 = true;
}
else
{
inwildy2 = false;
}
}[/code] and your done. not that hard right gl with it.

Read full topic
